intro: Anthocleista bequaertii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in moist, forested areas and can grow up to several meters in height. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
